paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted genetic variant information for KCNH2, including penetrance data.

patients.demographics: Two families, specific ages not mentioned
patients.phenotype: Short QT Syndrome, associated with syncope, palpitations, and sudden cardiac death

individual_records.phenotype_details: Spontaneous atrial fibrillation with rapid ventricular response
individual_records.evidence_sentence: In one family, a missense mutation with a cytosine to guanine substitution at nucleotide 1764 on KCNH2 was reported.

individual_records.phenotype_details: Died suddenly after two syncopal events
individual_records.evidence_sentence: In the second family a cytosine to adenine substitution at the same nucleotide was observed.

functional_data.summary: The N588K mutation causes a loss of the normal rectification of the current at plateau voltages, resulting in increased IKr during the action potential plateau.

variants.segregation_data: Both mutations segregated with disease in their respective families.
variants.additional_notes: Both mutations resulted in the same amino acid change of the cardiac Ikr channel.
key_quotes: Both mutations induced the substitution of the asparagine at codon 588 with a positive charged lysine (KCNH2-N588K).
The mutated KCNH2 channel (N588K) was co-expressed with and without the beta-subunit MiRP1 (KCNE2) in human embryonic kidney cells.

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data for KCNH2 variants were extracted successfully.
